definition[0]: to pay attention to what is happening around you, so that you will notice a particular person or thing if you see them
example[0]: Look out for your Aunt while you’re at the station.
example[1]: He’s looking out for a nice apartment downtown.
definition[1]: to try to make sure that someone is treated well
note[0]: look out for yourself/number one (=think only of the advantages you can get for yourself)
example[2]: My older brother always looked out for me when we were kids.
